paragraphs: My name's Vikram. I'm a PhD student in Computer Science at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

Research Interests: I'm fortunate to be advised by Prof. George Chacko, with guidance from Prof. Tandy Warnow. I'm interested in problems in network science (graph theory, social networks, etc.) and more recently, natural language processing (NLP). I've been working with using techniques from the aforementioned areas to study information diffusion and community formation across a variety of social networks. My core work in my group prior to the introduction of NLP has been in developing scalable algorithms for analyzing large-scale networks, with applications in social biological networks.
Prior to my PhD, I completed a Master's degree in Bioinformatics at UIUC as well, where I worked with Prof. Mohammed El-Kebir on computational methods for studying cancer metastasis.

I enjoy longboarding. I love animals: I ride and take care of horses and have three cats (swipe to see them!). I'm passionate about languages (though I have varying proficiency in them): I speak English, Telugu, Japanese (~N4 level), and I learned Spanish in high school and college.
Chai and Kali: Chai is the gray tabby, and Kali is the black cat.
Lokhi: Lokhi is my kitten. She was a stray that we actually found in our garage!
Pixie: Pixie is a sweet horse that I ride and take care of at a local stable.
Oreo: Oreo is another horse that I ride at the same stable as Pixie.
